Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: identified from the venom transcriptome of the spider Argiope bruennichi (Scopoli, 1772) using sequence alignment followed by online prediction tool analysis of a potential amphipathic region.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (47.62%) toBjRPS23(67-84)K: 18%; I=F: 12%; GRAVY: 0.46;  M Wt: 2010.446; Mol formula: C97H157N23O22; mol ex coeff: 1490.Activity: inhibited Gram+ B. cereus (MIC 4-64 uM) and S-aureus(MIC > 64 uM), Gram- E. coli (MIC 4 uM), MDR P. aeruginosa (MIC 4-64 uM), and fungi C. albicans (MIC 32 uM) and filamentous fungus F. oxysporum (MIC 8 uM).MOA:bacteria: it permeabilized membranes.Toxicity: The peptide showed a low toxicity to HaCaT (IC50 32-64 uM) and hADMSC (human primary mesenchymal stem cells) cells (IC50 64 uM).
Literature Information.Author: Shin MK, Hwang IW, Jang BY, Bu KB, Yoo JS, Sung JS.2023
Literature Information.Title: In silico identification of novel antimicrobial peptides from the venom gland transcriptome of the spider Argiope bruennichi (Scopoli, 1772).
